result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Damon Trammell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence; Court objections to electronic monitoring upon release

Provide DNA Sample; pay surcharge by 12-31-2022. Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay. All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid by 12/31/2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- $0.00 fines.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Damon Trammell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek Damon Trammell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler appeared by video for Derek Damon Trammell. Prosecuting attorney Claire Louise Starling appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is compliant. Case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Derek Damon Trammell in court, in custody.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court for Derek Damon Trammell.  Prosecuting attorney Claire Louise Starling appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for MENTAL HEALTH Plea/Sentencing hearing. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, court ordered the habitual criminality repeater enhancer removed in Count 1.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve  90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days served.  

Court objections to electronic monitoring upon release. 

CONDITIONS:
- $ 0.00 fines.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid by 12/31/2022. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Provide DNA Sample and pay surcharge by 12/31/2022.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 2:30 pm.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Jury instructions

Defendant Derek Damon Trammell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court for Derek Damon Trammell.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests case transfer to Branch 17 for resolution. Case adjourned, Branch 17.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with R.M.P.; Oak Leaf Trail
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derek Damon Trammell in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Derek Damon Trammell in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek Damon Trammell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.  
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast:https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
